tasks.task: Visit University of Kentucky's dairy farm to see compost bedded pack barn.
subtasks: Observe dairy cows using compost bedded pack barn.
Note how barn provides cow comfort and reduces mud exposure.

tasks.task: Implement compost bedded pack barn for beef cow-calf operation.
subtasks: Convert pasture facilities into compost bedded pack barn for 30-35 cows and calves.
Ensure easy management and visual contact with animals daily.
Control hay loss during feeding by managing hay distribution.
Maintain a sawdust loafing area for cows to rest and stay clean.
Rake the resting area twice daily to keep it fresh.
Safely manage herd while employees can check on animals easily.

tasks.task: Understand benefits of mud reduction for beef cattle.
subtasks: Recognize increased standing time due to mud can stress animals.
Realize 6-8 additional hours of standing in muddy conditions add up.
Consider animal comfort and stress reduction from mud-free resting areas.

tasks.task: Learn about facility transition for aging farmers.
subtasks: Note increasing age of farm populations.
Consider challenges of working off-farm and returning to muddy pastures.
Recognize compost bedded pack barn allows easier management off-farm.
Evaluate the concept for winter indoor housing post while pastures recover.
